content: The following lists events that happened during **1969 in Singapore**. ## Incumbents - [President](/wiki/President_of_Singapore): [Yusuf bin Ishak](/wiki/Yusuf_bin_Ishak) - [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore): [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) ## Events ### March - 26 March – The [Sentosa Satellite Earth Station](/wiki/Sentosa_Satellite_Earth_Station) is announced, which will take a year to set up. ### May - 13 May – [Ethnic riots](/wiki/May_13_Incident) break out in [Kuala Lumpur](/wiki/Kuala_Lumpur), [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia), which later spill over to Singapore. - 19 May – The [Singapore Petroleum Company](/wiki/Singapore_Petroleum_Company) is formed. ### July - 1 July – The first [SAF Day](/wiki/Singapore_Armed_Forces#History) was commemorated. - 18 July – Radio Television Singapore launches its fifth radio station, the ["FM Stereo Service" on 92.4 and 790 kHz](/wiki/Symphony_924). ### December - 10 December – Floods hit Singapore after heavy rain, leaving five fatalities. ## Births - 10 January – [Tan Chuan-Jin](/wiki/Tan_Chuan-Jin), former politician and former [speaker](/wiki/Speaker_of_the_Parliament_of_Singapore). - 10 February – [Poh Lip Meng](/wiki/Poh_Lip_Meng), national sport shooter (d. (/wiki/2021_in_Singapore)). - 7 March - [Huang Biren](/wiki/Huang_Biren), actress. - 9 April - [M Ravi](/wiki/M_Ravi), human rights lawyer and activist (d. (/wiki/2025_in_Singapore)). - 14 May – [Lim Tong Hai](/wiki/Lim_Tong_Hai), national football player. - 17 June – [James Lye](/wiki/James_Lye), former actor. - 10 July – [Hossan Leong](/wiki/Hossan_Leong), television personality. - 12 August – [Edwin Tong](/wiki/Edwin_Tong), lawyer and politician. - 1 September – [Lam Pin Min](/wiki/Lam_Pin_Min), former doctor and former politician. - 9 October – [Chan Chun Sing](/wiki/Chan_Chun_Sing), former army general and politician. - 15 November – [Ong Ye Kung](/wiki/Ong_Ye_Kung), former civil servant and politician. - Date unknown - [Douglas Foo](/wiki/Douglas_Foo), Founder of Apex-Pal International Ltd (which owns [Sakae Sushi](/wiki/Sakae_Sushi)), former [Nominated Member of Parliament](/wiki/Nominated_Member_of_Parliament). ## Deaths - 15 March – [Percival Frank Aroozoo](/wiki/Percival_Frank_Aroozoo), former principal of [Gan Eng Seng School](/wiki/Gan_Eng_Seng_School) (b. 1900). - 8 July – [Robert Lim](/wiki/Robert_Lim), medical doctor and eldest son of [Lim Boon Keng](/wiki/Lim_Boon_Keng) (b. 1897). - 5 October – [John Davies](/wiki/John_Davies_(judge)), 1st [Attorney-General of the Crown Colony of Singapore](/wiki/Attorney-General_of_Singapore) (b. 1898). This Singapore-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: 1969 in Singapore
